I just returned from Italy and I’d like to start a thread of things that were surprises to me when traveling.

* We hired a private boat to take us from Sorrento to stops along the Amalfi Coast. It was a 19’ boat that was supposed to accommodate 6 guests plus the skipper. It was ROUGH. We ended up only doing one stop because we didn’t want to be on the boat any longer. I truly think the driver was very inexperienced and that was the reason for the unpleasant experience, but that aside…when the boats pull up, prepare yourself for a ‘bumpy’ exit and entrance. It is very wavy and you really just have to try to time it and cross your fingers. And this is all boats, not just the one we took. We sat and watched for a while and can’t believe we didn’t see anyone fall into the water. We did, however, see an older lady who had to be carried off because the ride there was so hard on her. I wouldn’t recommend a boat arrival to anyone elderly.

* So many people say that you can pay with card for anything and that’s just not the case. We traveled the entire country and needed cash for so many things. For example..water taxi to the airport in Venice, private guide to Pompeii through our hired car company, all of the tourist nightly taxes. These were all larger amounts, so yes, keep cash on you.

* Download apps before you arrive if you won’t have cellular service. I didn’t think about this and waited to download some apps but they needed a text code and we only had a data package(taxi apps for Rome, or anything you need to link payment to).

* Yes, it is cheaper to do certain things that you arrange yourself, but sometimes it’s just more practical to let someone else handle the details and planning. I was planning our trip for a year and the transportation part had me so stressed that I postponed the entire thing for another year. I ended up booking some private transfers and it all fell in line. (I live in a small town and public transportation anywhere is so intimidating for me. I know this isn’t an option for some people).

I hope this post doesn’t come off negative. That isn’t my goal. I absolutely LOVED our trip and feel blessed I was able to take it.

Please add any not commonly talked about points to this post. I see a lot of the same things on all the pages I follow. Just hoping to help others with the less talked about things.
